question: The Core inflation is different from the general inflation because of the following?
option1: Core Inflation is caused by the supply Shock in certain essential commodities
option2: Core Inflation is the sudden increase in certain items of food grains
option3: Core Inflation is the inflation rate of a particular basket of commodities
option4: Core Inflation is just a misnomer
answer: Core Inflation is the inflation rate of a particular basket of commodities
explanation: Core Inflation is the rate of inflation calculated to exclude certain items that are subject to sudden and short-lived price movements, mainly food and energy. Core inflation is considered a better indicator of overall long-term than un-adjusted headline inflation.
